First, I should figure out how many tires are needed per week. Since each car requires 4 tires, and they produce 200 cars each week, I can multiply 200 by 4 to get the weekly tire requirement.

200 cars/week * 4 tires/car = 800 tires/week

Okay, so the factory needs 800 tires every week.

Now, to find out the annual requirement, I need to know how many weeks there are in a year. Typically, there are 52 weeks in a year. So, if the factory needs 800 tires each week, I can multiply that by 52 to get the total number of tires needed in a year.

800 tires/week * 52 weeks/year = 41,600 tires/year
